answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in.This throbbing or twitching feeling could be because of stress or fatigue. Cold fingertips can occur due diabetes, peripheral neuropathy like B12 deficiency and peripheral arterial disease (PAD) like reynauds disease. PAD is usually seen in people who have a long standing history of smoking.I would suggest you to discuss these possibilities with your PCP and do keep us posted!

question: I am a healthy, 35 year old woman who feels these pulsating, throbbing movements (sometimes) under my skin. it feels like something is bubbling under my skin, moving through for short periods of time, not painful. I felt this in my legs, arms, chest, pelvic areas.  I also have @ times cold, numb fingertips & toes (feels like ice) no matter what season we are in. I am always cold, sometimes i can wear a couple of shirts & pants to keep myself warm. I am very active person who weighs 122 lbs with short stature, no major medical problems.  What would you recommend I do? I get physicals done every year, my doctor tells me not to worry my body is changing/ getting older. What do you think it can be?Nay
title: pulsating, throbbing movement throughout my body @ times
